paragraphs.content: Psalm 107
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 107

paragraphs.content: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O give thanks unto the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

paragraphs.content: Let the redeemed of the LORD say so, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let the redeemed of the Lord say so, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy;

paragraphs.content: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east, and from the west, from the north, and from the south.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east, and from the west, from the north, and from the south.

paragraphs.content: They wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way; they found no city to dwell in.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way; they found no city to dwell in.

paragraphs.content: Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.

paragraphs.content: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses.

paragraphs.content: And he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.

paragraphs.content: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
paragraphs.contentHtml: Oh that men would praise the Lord for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

paragraphs.content: For he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.

paragraphs.content: Such as sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and iron;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Such as sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and iron;

paragraphs.content: Because they rebelled against the words of God, and contemned the counsel of the most High:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because they rebelled against the words of God, and contemned the counsel of the most High:

paragraphs.content: Therefore he brought down their heart with labour; they fell down, and there was none to help.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore he brought down their heart with labour; they fell down, and there was none to help.

paragraphs.content: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then they cried unto the Lord in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.

paragraphs.content: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and brake their bands in sunder.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and brake their bands in sunder.

paragraphs.content: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
paragraphs.contentHtml: Oh that men would praise the Lord for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

paragraphs.content: For he hath broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron in sunder.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he hath broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron in sunder.

paragraphs.content: Fools because of their transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Fools because of their transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted.

paragraphs.content: Their soul abhorreth all manner of meat; and they draw near unto the gates of death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their soul abhorreth all manner of meat; and they draw near unto the gates of death.

paragraphs.content: Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble, and he saveth them out of their distresses.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then they cry unto the Lord in their trouble, and he saveth them out of their distresses.

paragraphs.content: He sent his word, and healed them, and delivered them from their destructions.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He sent his word, and healed them, and delivered them from their destructions.

paragraphs.content: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
paragraphs.contentHtml: Oh that men would praise the Lord for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

paragraphs.content: And let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his works with rejoicing.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his works with rejoicing.

paragraphs.content: They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters;
paragraphs.contentHtml: They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters;

paragraphs.content: These see the works of the LORD, and his wonders in the deep.
paragraphs.contentHtml: These see the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep.

paragraphs.content: For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.

paragraphs.content: They mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths: their soul is melted because of trouble.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths: their soul is melted because of trouble.

paragraphs.content: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wits’ end.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wits’ end.

paragraphs.content: Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then they cry unto the Lord in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses.

paragraphs.content: He maketh the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof are still.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He maketh the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof are still.

paragraphs.content: Then are they glad because they be quiet; so he bringeth them unto their desired haven.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then are they glad because they be quiet; so he bringeth them unto their desired haven.

paragraphs.content: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!
paragraphs.contentHtml: Oh that men would praise the Lord for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

paragraphs.content: Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.

paragraphs.content: He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;
paragraphs.contentHtml: He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;

paragraphs.content: A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

paragraphs.content: He turneth the wilderness into a standing water, and dry ground into watersprings.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He turneth the wilderness into a standing water, and dry ground into watersprings.

paragraphs.content: And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation;
paragraphs.contentHtml: And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation;

paragraphs.content: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.

paragraphs.content: He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

paragraphs.content: Again, they are minished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Again, they are minished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.

paragraphs.content: He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.

paragraphs.content: Yet setteth he the poor on high from affliction, and maketh him families like a flock.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yet setteth he the poor on high from affliction, and maketh him families like a flock.

paragraphs.content: The righteous shall see it, and rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The righteous shall see it, and rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.

paragraphs.content: Whoso is wise, and will observe these things, even they shall understand the lovingkindness of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso is wise, and will observe these things, even they shall understand the lovingkindness of the Lord.
